meanings.definition: The rank or dignity of a knight.
meanings.sent1: In the kingdom, knighthoods were highly respected titles.
meanings.sent2: The queen bestowed knighthoods upon the brave warriors.
meanings.sent3: The ceremony for receiving knighthoods involved a lot of fancy outfits.
meanings.sent4: To some, achieving knighthoods was like reaching the pinnacle of honor.
meanings.sent5: Legends were told of the noble deeds done by those with knighthoods.

meanings.definition: The title or dignity of a knight.
meanings.sent1: The knighthoods were displayed proudly on the knights' shields.
meanings.sent2: Sir Lancelot carried his knighthoods with grace and humility.
meanings.sent3: The young squire dreamt of one day earning his knighthoods.
meanings.sent4: The knighthoods shone brightly in the sunlight, a symbol of valor.
meanings.sent5: The king announced the new knighthoods with great ceremony.

meanings.sent1: The knighthoods rode together into battle, a formidable force.
meanings.sent2: The castle was guarded by the loyal knighthoods.
meanings.sent3: The group of knighthoods practiced their swordsmanship skills daily.
meanings.sent4: The knighthoods gathered in the great hall to discuss their next quest.
meanings.sent5: Legends spoke of the unity and strength of the knighthoods in times of need.
